ovdesc.p: The MD.BALANCES file records all the principal movements of a particular MD.DEAL together with future charges to be deducted, and a summary of those charges that are associated with the MD.DEAL.

A MD.BALANCES record is created whenever an MD.DEAL is entered into the system and remains there as long as the deal remains 'live' on the MD.DEAL file. It is updated automatically by any of the routines which modify the principal or charge fields on the deal.
There is no facility for direct input to this file. The information retained on this file can be grouped into the following sections:
1. PRINCIPAL DETAILS (Fields 1-2) These two fields correspond to the principal amount of the MD.DEAL and the date that the amount became effective.

2. FUTURE CHARGES (Fields 3-6) These four fields contain details of the charges that have not yet been debited from the customer account. They consist of the date the charges are due to be applied, the currency the charges will be applied in together with both the charge code and amounts which will be debited on the actual date.
3. CHARGE SUMMARY (Fields 7-8) The last two fields make up a multi-value set of currency and total charges (past and future) that will or have been debited to the customer in respect to the deal.

ACCR.ACT.AMT
Last of the Accrual multi-value set. This holds the un-rounded amount of commission accrued for the multi-value accrual group in question.
System Maintained.
ACCR.AMT

Commission is accrued to six decimal places and then rounded in such a way that the error in rounding is kept to the minimum. The six decimal un-rounded amount is held in the field ACCR.ACT.AMT. Any rounding error from a given accrual group is carried forward via the un-rounded accrual amount of the following group. However, this is true only if the following group is a part of the same commission period.
System Maintained.
ACCR.DAYS
Identifies the number of days for which the commission accrual has taken place within the multi-value set of ACCR.FROM.DATE to ACCR.ACT.AMT.
System Maintained.
ACCR.FROM.DATE

For the current commission schedule this field holds the value of the Accrual start date. The set of fields ACCR.FROM.DATE to ACCR.ACT.AMT form a multi-value set of commission accrual fields. These record all the details of commission accrued for the contract.
Information is stored in these fields in a reverse chronological order, i.e. the most recent accrual details will be found on top of the multi-value sets for a given commission schedule.
System Maintained.
